alert.note: Alert for Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:48AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Aroostook County through 745 AM EDT... At 647 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm 25 miles west of Saint Pamphile, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Brief heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Deboullie Mountain, Frenchville, New Canada, Allagash Township, Dickey, Cross Lake, Wallagrass, Winterville, Saint Francis, Daigle, Soldier Pond, Saint John and Saint Agatha. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Madawaska and Fort Kent. State Highway 11 between Eagle Lake and Fort Kent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
